summary: Inspect which sources are cached locally, along with metadata, staleness information, and alias mappings.

usage.description: Preferred mode for agents. Returns an array with alias, url, tags, lastUpdated, checksum, descriptor, and status fields.
Human-friendly table augmented with ETag, Last-Modified, and last update timestamps.
Expands descriptors (description/category/tags) alongside the core table.

agent_use_cases: Determine whether a source already exists before calling `blz add`.
Detect stale caches: `blz list --json | jq '.[] | select(.stalenessDays > 3)'`.
Feature discovery: inspect descriptors to surface categories when building orchestrated prompts.
fields_of_interest: alias – canonical name used across CLI commands.
url / fallbackUrl – where updates pull content from.
checksum – sha256 of current content (useful for deduping).
stalenessDays – integer representing days since last successful update.
descriptor.meta.displayName – optional human-friendly label if provided.
follow_up_commands: Run `blz refresh <alias>` (deprecated alias: `blz update <alias>`) for stale entries.
Use `blz remove <alias>` to delete unused caches.
Pair with `blz lookup --prompt` to find additional sources to onboard.
